detailsOfAchievement: To organised Different form of Classical and Folk Dances, Classical & Folk Music Folk Songs and indigenous musical instruments, Theatre an other Traditional and indigenous Theatres etc. Varieties of Traditional Costumes and Designs. Different folk craft-earthen wares, wood works, cane and bamboo works, iron works and works of animal hide. To undertake research to retrieve the vast vanishing arts and crafts and also to create new forms and designs, crafts to suit the modern development but basing on the traditional arts and crafts. To establish an institution to impart and propagate the knwoledge of traditional arts and crafts. This institution will also be the centre for research. To organize Tours, Shows, Demonstrations or Presentation of the new productions of the organisation in connection with the Dance, Drama and Music of Manipur related to the aims and objects. To encourage and assist production of new arts by awarding prizes etc. To enter into agreement with authors and persons for dramatic and other rights of opera, plays, burlesques, ballets spectacular Arts musical and dramatic competitions and other entertainment. To encourage and promote dramatic activities, and theatre the open air theatre in its various art forms. To promote traditional and non traditional dance and musical exchange of ideas for National Integration and social Health. To set up information recreational centre and libraries. To organise various awareness generating programme on different issues through culture. To create awareness among the people residing both in rural and urban areas including SC and ST, Minorities and Other Backward Classes for their development programmes, rural development, sports development, welfares of children. To impart training programmes to individuals and groups in Handloom and Handicrafts. Bamboo products, Rural Industries Programme, Crafts Training Centres, wood Carving etc. To establish the institutions, disabled schools, ashram schools, boarding schools, street children and victims of drug abuse and orphanage home, destitute home.

detailsOfAchievement: The major activities undertaken by the organization during the period 2008 are as follows- RIAC Project- The organization is presently covering a sub-division in Tamenglong district covering ward no. I-X, with an approximate population of 19662, having Male-9757 and Female-9905. Some of the finding by our organization of Tamenglong District in undergoing the RIAC project as a part of the National AIDS Control Programme (NACP) under Manipur State AIDS Control Society (MACS) as sponsored by National AIDS Control Organisation (NACO) , which is under the Ministry of Health & Family Welfare, Govt. of India . The specified target for undergoing the RIAC Project for IDUs are 300. We could successfully conduct 30 Community meeting participated by 926 from all works of life mainly community leaders, 108 group discussion participated by 539 members, focus group discussion of 5 with 29 leaders of all section indulging in the project, a whooping 5653 one-to-one interaction , 30316 condom distribution , 27412 distribution of condom with average 66.25% return rate , 24 clients giving detoxification , 153 STI or STD cases and a large no. of 157 given referral cases. PPTCT Project- The said project is implemented by our organization in Tamenglong District as a part of the NACP under Global Fund for AIDS, TB & Malaria (GFATM Round-II) through Manipur State AIDS Control Society (MACS) as sponsored by NACO , which is under the Ministry of Health & Family Welfare, Govt. of India. The main role of the project is to assist and recommend the pregnant women in the project area(s) towards HIV-AIDS testing in the VCCTC- PPTCT Centers of the district and help in providing the much needed nutritional support for the positive ones. The major achievement in undergoing the PPTCT project is 1000 pregnant women in Tamenglong District.

detailsOfAchievement: The Agent for Social Change (ASOC) is a charitable, non profit making and multi-sectoral voluntary organization working without distinction of caste, creed, religion and community for the welfare and upliftment of the poor, marginalized and disables in our society. It was formed by a group of likeminded people having different background and experiences in social works. It was established in the year 1994 and registered under Manipur Societies Regulation Act of 1989 in the year 1998. Activities of the ASOC are as follow: Prevention of Parent to Child Transmission of HIV (PPTCT) Project, Seminar cum Workshop Programme on Food Processing. Awareness Programme on Collection of Seasonal Wild vegetables, fungus and fruits, Climate Change & Mitigation, Awareness Programme on Agriculture, Biodiversity Conservation, Bird Flue awareness, Child Education, Community Based Rehabilitation (CBR) programme, Community Food Security, Community Sanitation & Hygiene, Globalization, Conflict resolution, Aromatic Plants Cultivation, Conservation of Wetland & Protection of Wild life, Conservation of water: Rain water harvesting and Gravitational water management. Disaster management, Eco-tourism & Community employment, Deforestation & Jhum cultivation, Mega Dams: Development & Impacts to local communities, Employment generation, Fishery, Entrepreneurship awareness, Floriculture, Agricultural Cooperative, Food Security Awareness, Gender & Women Empowerment, Herbal Medicine: Traditional knowledge & Practice, HIV-AIDS: Stigma & Discrimination, Human Rights, HIV-AIDS & Disability, Livelihood & Sustainable Development, Awareness Programme on HIV â€“ TB Co-infection, Horticulture, Indigenous & tribal rights & ownership on natural resources. Awareness Programme on Malaria Awareness, Awareness Programme on Information Technology (I.T), Awareness Programme on Local Capacity for Peace (LCP), Health Awareness Programme and organizing Medical Camp, Optimum Utilization of forest resources, Micro - credit awareness, Networking, Alliance building and coordination, Organic farming, Project Planning and management, Pollution Control, Protection and Conservation of Forest, Environment & Ecology, Preservation & Protection of Indigenous & Tribal Symbolic, Articles / objects / monuments, Reproductive Child Health (RCH), SHG Awareness, Rain water harvesting, Soil Conservation, Renewable Energy: Wind, Solar & micro-hydel, Solid Waste management , TB , Watershed management, Trafficking: Child & Girl, Traditional Birth Attendance & Dias. Sensitization on Trans ASEAN Highway & Look Acts Policy, Sensitization on Good Governance and Democratization, Sensitization on Racism and Discrimination, Sensitization on Militarization and AFSPA 1958 (as a part of Human Rights prog), Upliftment of Socially marginal groups, Awareness Programme of Widows and Destitute women, Adolescent, Violence against Women and Girl child, Infectious diseases, Sensitization on Leadership Development Programme, Awareness Programme on Entrepreneurship

Free Coaching Classes : The Pre- Examination Coaching (for SC/ST/OBC/Minorities), which is housed within the premises of OCI a group of Amir Shahabuddin Healthcare Trust, is actively angaged in imparting free coaching to the candidate belonging to the Scheduled Casts (SC), Scheduled Tribes (ST), Other Backward Classes (OBC) and Minorities for competitive examinations, since the Year 2014.

HEALTH CARE PROGRAMME FOR YOGA AND NATUROPATHY: Most of the families in rural areas of manipur state are not getting proper Health care and Sanitation and do not have proper house hold latrine due to how family income as a result a lots of disease spread time to time in remote areas and most of the health checkup type is of Allopathic.

ESTABLISHMENT OF HEALTH CLINIC : As a part of the proper health care programme for backward and rural masses the AMIR SHAHABUDDIN HEALTHCARE TRUST establish a health clinic for rural poor and backward families. During the year the clinic benefited 48 persons to their Health and Nutrition Support.

detailsOfAchievement: Care Foundation has been implementing targeted intervention program for injecting drug users in two districts of Manipur namely imphal east and bishnupur. And another Integrated care clinics which is a linkage services for injecting drug user their spouse and children. Major activities include case management of antiretroviral therapy and hiv testing at Integrated counseling testing and tuberculosis screening and sexual transmitted disease screening and general health care including laboratory diagnosis for people living with hiv as well as basic services for spouses of injecting drug users. So far in imphal east district we have achieved coverage of 159 injecting drug user for needles syringe and condom and 100 injecting drug users for opioid substitution therapy and 119 spouses of injecting drug users. In bishnupur district 391 injecting drug users have covered under needle syringe and condom services and 91 under opioid substitution therapy and 124 female sex workers were currently giving necessary services. Under integrated care clinics 4478 antiretroviral therapy cases and 1877 tested for hiv and 189 screened for tuberculosis and 766 were screened for sexually transmitted infections across the state of Manipur. Under control of parent to child transmission of hiv parts of bishnupur district was covered and through outreach intervention so far 142 hiv positive women were identified and contacted out of which 112 women deliver their child free from hiv and rest are lost of follow up due to various reasons. Under tuberculosis awareness program in imphal eats district so far 556 household were surveyed and given awareness on tuberculosis. As part of advocacy and networking with multiple stakeholders we have been continuously join hand with many cso government agencies mainly health institutions and department of state aids control society and department of social welfare manipur during events or community participations. As a part of community lead awareness and treatment for viral hepatitis c we have initiated in alow threshold manner due to financial constraint. This is critical because many hiv positive persons who are also living with hepatitis c infection are still in dilemma because antiretroviral therapy is available free of cost at government hospitals but treatment for viral hepatitis is out of reach to many common man living with viral hepatitis c.

detailsOfAchievement: Care MIssion Kasom khullen Ukhrul District Manipur is a non Governmental, non political, non secterian, non-profit making and secular voluntary organisation established by the dedicated youths women and well wishers of Ukhrul District Manipur for awareness, development welfare and socio-economics condition of the people belonging to the weaker section of Manipur with a view to improve all round development of the people living in the rural/urban, slum and other remoted areas and minorities community in the state. Care Mission was established on 4th july 1985 and registeed under the Registration No 36/UD/SR/85-86. The organisation Care Mission is one of the reputed organisation in Ukhrul District Manipur. It has sufficient voluntary member, resource person,artist,vocational instructor and other dedicated leader with well equiped office located in the heart of Kasom khullen sub-divission head quater Ukhrul District Manipur. The organisation Care Mission has been doing awareness and development works since its inception. Care Mission organised various activities such as workshop, seminars,treee plantationprogramme, HIV/AIDS awareness programme, horticulture development programme, creche centre seminar on education, literacy meet, consumer awareness programme, eradication of child labour programme etc, on district and state level, and it bringing awareness among the masses, thus giving an opportunity to our youngster.

detailsOfAchievement: The Centre for Youth and Cultural Activities, Khurai Puthiba Leikai, Imphal, Manipur erstwhile Sangeetniketan Khurai was established in 1984 by a group of young artistes and eminent social workers with a view to take up various activities to promote art and culture and welfare of the people of Manipur. Later in the year 1985, it was registered under the Societies Registration Act, 1860 with the registration number of 6064 of 1985 as non profit making, non political, non sectarian and Non Governmental Voluntary Organisation and. The CYCA, Khurai has its own performing unit consisting of well-trained and certified degree holder Artistes and Instrumentalist as well as child Artistes. It has been running successfully a school of Music since 1986 and later adds the dance training classes. Now it is one of the leading Cultural Organisation in Manipur. AIMS AND OBJECTS: The main objectives of the Association are to render service for welfare of the members and non-members of the society in general and to set up welfare programme relating to women, children, old aged persons and youths and to encourage and assisting production of new plays by awarding prizes etc. and to promote folk dance, song & drama, to arrange stipend, scholarship to students., to provide free cultural programme to the local people and to establish aged home and day care centre for elderly people and maintain a creational centre for children and public libraries and to arrange and held periodical lecture, discussion, seminars, conferences and workshop for the developing the knowledge of literate and illiterate persons and to construct cultural building, establish dance academy, music college and others educational centers and to assist the urban and rural poor specially tribes, scheduled caste for their economic sustenance and rise fund by receiving members subscription, contribution, public donation, loans and financial assistance the Govt. agencies and to take up any activities which are incidental and conductive to the attainment of the above objects. Now CYCA has working jointly with Indira Gandhi Rashtriya Manav Sangrahalaya (IGRMS), Bhopal in their any museum activities held at Manipur and other part of the Country. It is purely a non-political, non-sectarian, non-religious and non-profit making voluntary organisations. CYCA was actively involved in the field work, Lecturer programme, collection, hosting seminar, workshop in Manipur and at Indira Gandhi Rashtriya Manav Sangrahalaya, IGRMS, National Museum of Mankind, Bhopal. This were executed by the IGRMS and the team of CYCA., we are chosen as resource persons. In addition the CYCA was able to send of performing art groups for cultural presentation at different state of India as desired by the cultural organisation especially at the IGRMS. The CYCA also work jointly with Local museum like People Museum Kakching in the documentation of cultural Integrity of Manipur. The following programmes were organized during the year 2008-09: Three Days Tour Programme with IGRMS at kakching, Ningel, Andro, Imphal & Khoirentak villages in 3 district of Manipur on 15th to 18th April, 2008. Open air exhibition on U-Hakpa Traditional wood carving of Manipur at the IGRMS, Campus from 05-19 July, 2008. 10day workshop on Traditional wood carving of Manipur at Tribal Museum and Research centre, Imphal, organized in collaboration with IGRMS. â€œSaptaparniâ€, Festival of Performing Arts from Seven North Eastern states, 18th-20th oct., 2008 A group of 20 members including 16 children led by Shri L. Ibomcha Meitei participated in the National Bal Rang Festival, 2008, held on 19-21, Dec., 2008 at IGRMS campus Bhopal and secured 2nd position with cash prize Rs. 11,000 and trophy with certificates. A team of 4 artisans send at IGRMS, Bhopal for development of Exhibit under the theme of river valley culture, from 15th dec. 2008 to 2 Jan., 2009. A group of 15 artistes of CYCA participated cultural programme held at Tripura on 16th June, 2008 orgd. by Jananeta Hijam Irabot Memorial Trust, Dharmanagar & Irabot Foundation Manipur. CYCA participated in the cultural programme in International Symposium on Newer Frontiers in Biomedical Research, 28-29 June, 2008 orgd. by Regional Medical Research Centre, NE, Dibrugah, Assam. Organised, 5-day training programme on Meitei Pung on 23th-27th July, 2008. The artistes of CYCA participated in the Cultural Programme held at Manipur University on 22nd Aug. 2008. Organised, one day Patriotic Song Competition on 13 August, 2008 9 artistes of the CYCA presented a performance of Ras Leela on 28th Aug. 2008 at Manipur Dramatic Union, Imphal orgd. by Irabot Cherrity Trust. 7 artistes of the CYCA participated cultural programme held at IIT Guwahati on 4th Sept. 2008. Organised, one day Song & Music Competition on 14 September, 2008. Every year the students and artistes of the CYCA organised Guru Pujah. In this year it was held on 20th September, 2008. CYCA was organised world older day in honour of the older persons which is admitted in our Multi care Centre on 1st october, 2008. The artistes at this CYCA presented a cultural programme on the occasion of the 13th Annual conference, Association of surgeons of India, Manipur State Chapter held on 11th October, 2008 at RIMS, Imphal. 4 artistes of the CYCA participated State Level Youth Festival held on 4-8 December, 2008 at Imphal orgd. by Youth Affairs & Sports Deptt. Govt. of Manipur. On the occasion of closing function in the All India Inter University Judo (M/W) Tournament, 2008-09 held on 30th Dec. 2008 at Manipur Central University, the CYCA presented a cultural programme. A team of 3 artistes presented Pung Cholom & Dhol Dulok Cholom at IIT, Guwahati on 17th January 2009. Organised, 2-day Workshop on Traditional Manipuri Music & Song on 24th-25th January, 2009. The CYCA had conducted 7-day Residential Camp for old aged persons at Longpi Kajui Village, Ukhrul District from 9th-15th Feb,, 2009.
